title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 31): Telling Our Own Stories - How to Build a Community Media Platform as a Power With Project
summary: A guide to creating community-controlled media platforms that decentralize authorship, avoid gatekeeping, and center collective self-representation over extraction.

Communication.summary: Build community-controlled media platforms that amplify many voices and challenge dominant narratives.

level0: Listen to community members about what stories aren't being told
Start simple with zines, newsletters, or audio recordings
Host story circles to identify whose voices are missing
level1: Form a horizontal collective of co-editors and facilitators
Choose accessible mediums based on local resources and skills
Create group agreements for consensus-based decision making
level2: Publish regular community media using rotating roles and shared authorship
Host skill-shares for layout, audio editing, and storytelling techniques
Build networks with other community media collectives
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous media cells in other communities
Advocate for community media access and media justice policies
Create lasting infrastructure for grassroots media production

Narrative.summary: Challenge dominant media representations by creating platforms for collective self-representation and community voice.

level0: Question who controls the narrative about your community
Practice telling stories from community perspective rather than outsider extraction
Share examples of successful community-controlled media
level1: Document community stories that mainstream media ignores or misrepresents
Challenge extractive journalism practices in your area
Create counter-narratives through accessible community media
level2: Lead community conversations about media representation and power
Amplify marginalized voices through locally-controlled platforms
Share successful models of horizontal media organizing
level3: Contribute to broader media justice movements and policy advocacy
Develop and share analysis of community media as liberation practice
Mentor other communities in starting their own media collectives

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share skills for community-controlled media production and horizontal organizing practices.

level0: Learn about different community media formats and tools
Study successful examples like Youth Speaks and Lxs Grises
level1: Practice basic media production skills like layout, audio editing, and writing
Learn consensus decision-making and horizontal organizing methods
Develop skills in trauma-informed and accessibility-conscious media making
level2: Host workshops teaching community media production to others
Create open-source templates and resources for other collectives
Share knowledge about avoiding hierarchical media structures
level3: Develop comprehensive toolkits for community media organizing
Research and document best practices for horizontal media production
Train facilitators and organizers in other communities
